Nouy: Our most valuable contribution to economic growth is to do our job: implementing regulation consistently and taking action when needed
Nouy: SSM working to harmonise close to 100 options & national discretions. Draft ECB regulation for public consultation from early November
Nouy: By harmonising supervisory practices, we contribute to a level playing field and make capital and liquidity ratios easier to compare
Nouy: Supervised banks should be subject to consistent prudential requirements regardless of where their business is located
Speech Danièle Nouy: Safety and progress, an SSM perspective https://t.co/YruUmqGSjo (EN) https://t.co/6rBtm6NSxM (DE)
Economic Bulletin Box: International institutions estimate there is still a considerable amount of slack in the euro area in 2015
Economic Bulletin Box: A survey-based measure of slack for the euro area http://t.co/BcbtJ4YAgC
Economic Bulletin: The upturn in house prices is favourable for the macroeconomy and has posed little risk for financial stability up to now
Economic Bulletin: The upturn in house prices has thus far been accompanied by only a rather muted recovery in credit growth
Economic Bulletin: The house price cycle has turned the corner and can be expected to gradually strengthen further http://t.co/DehBLOSXqY
Economic Bulletin: The state of the house price cycle in the euro area http://t.co/DehBLOSXqY

Nouy: Fruitful exchanges with US and IMF attest that as much as good regulation and vigilant supervision is key, so is int’l cooperation
Nouy: Unfortunately, a few cases of national options still need to be harmonised, so the dialogue with legislators is ongoing
Nouy: We have agreed on harmonised implementation of many of the 150 existing national options in the Europe
Nouy: Devoted to tough supervision, we strive to be fair and even-handed, while avoiding one-size fits all approach
Nouy: Current round of determining capital levels for individual banks shows growing supervisory consistency

Draghi: Imperfection of our union is source of instabilities
Draghi: There was no discussion on changing size or pace of the purchase programme today
Draghi: Issue share limit increase meant to maintain smooth implementation of the public sector purchase programme
Draghi: In the future, a national central bank can seek approval of the Governing Council to communicate on ELA
Draghi: For the waiver consistent and significant implementation of the programme is necessary
Draghi: It is true that the ECB insisted to exclude any depositor bail-in for Greek banks
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/NhRNp3uD2V
Draghi: Fiscal policies should support the economic recovery while remaining in compliance with the Stability and Growth Pact
Draghi: The ongoing cyclical recovery should be supported by effective structural policies
Draghi: There are downside risks to the September staff inflation projections
Draghi: September macroeconomic projections foresee HICP inflation at 0.1% in 2015 [previous 0.3%], 1.1% in 2016 [1.5%], 1.7% in 2017 [1.8%]
Draghi: September macroeconomic projections foresee GDP increasing by 1.4% in 2015 [previous 1.5%], 1.7% in 2016 [1.9%], 1.8% in 2017 [2.0%]
Draghi: Asset purchases are intended to run until the end of September 2016, or beyond, if necessary
Draghi: We will fully implement the monthly asset purchases of €60 billion
Draghi: The asset purchase programme provides sufficient flexibility t.t.o of adjusting the size, composition and duration of the programme
Draghi: We are willing and able to act, if warranted, by using all the instruments available within our mandate
Draghi: We will closely monitor all relevant incoming information
Draghi: Premature to conclude on whether recent developments could have a lasting impact
Draghi: Renewed downside risks have emerged to the outlook for growth and inflation
Draghi: We decided to increase the issue share limit in the public sector purchase programme from 25% to 33%
Monetary policy decisions: rates unchanged http://t.co/la0bFRvY8c
